name: Hotel Majestic Roma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Neo classical, elegant hotel with good size rooms and big beds, very conveniently located on the Via Veneto where you are spoilt for choice of restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Helpful and attentive staff were quick to make recommendations and bookings. The location was perfect for walking to any of the main sights in Rome.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for a few nights in September 2011 (late review I know). I was planning my engagement in Rome and was in contact with the concierges to get recommendations, make reservations, etc. They were always very responsive and had great recommendations. Once my wife and I arrived to the hotel the first rate service continued. All the concierges (Faisal in particular) made our stay wonderful at every turn. They even organized a private tour of a winery just outside of Rome. Our room was excellent and well-appointed. We left to go to Venice for a couple days and they held some of our bags and made sure there were in our room upon our return. The room was nicely decorated; luxurious and just modern enough to be chic but not cold. The room in which we stayed is probably my wife's favorite ever. The location is also great. Walking distance for the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain. Can't say enough good things about the hotel. I don't think we can stay anywhere else in Rome and look forward to our return.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel & Service

reviews.text: Beautiful glossy, elegant and romantic neo classical hotel, frequented by the stars.
reviews.title: Que Bella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Helpful and attentive staff
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: Ideally situated for visits on foot to the sites
reviews.title: 1st class luxury hotel
Excellent Hotel - Convenient Location
reviews.text: We had the opportunity to stay at Hotel Majestic for three nights at the start of an 8 day tour of Italy. We were delighted with the choice by the tour operator. Located on the Via Veneto, the Majestic is well located for sightseeing. It's not far from the Spanish steps, and - for folks in good shape without physical limitations - is within walking distance of a lot of the sights on the east side of the Tiber. We had a lovely room, overlooking a quiet rear street. The room amenities were superior, and the hotel staff could not have been more courteous and professional. An outstanding breakfast with a large variety of options was served daily.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fine property, and we'd be delighted to return on future visits!
reviews.title: Perfect for Roma!

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Hotel Majestic Rome fir 3 nights. The hotel's style and furniture are just perfect for Rome and fit in greatly while still providing comfort and luxury. All the staff members were extremely nice and helpful and always took their time to give us tips and advice to ensure we had a pleasant time. The hotel's location is also one of its great strength, a metro station is one minute away and you can easily walk to some of the biggest attractions in Rome such as Fountain Di Trevi and Spanish Steps. We loved the hotel, we loved Rome. We just think this hotel belongs in Rome and is just perfect for Rome :)
reviews.title: A Must Stay!

reviews.text: We started our expedition in Rome at the Hotel Majestic and stayed 4 nights. We were extremely excited when arriving early in the morning after an international flight, however not able to check in until after 2 p.m., which was difficult. Once in the room, we were exceeding satisfied with our choice to stay at Hotel Majestic. Beautiful hotel from the lobby to the rooms, and elegant decor. The location gave access to many attractions and nearby metro station. Staff was friendly. Free wifi.
reviews.title: Another amazing stay at the Hotel Majestic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Seven years ago, we traveled to Rome and stayed at the Hotel Majestic. The staff was so friendly and the location about the best you could ask for. I was nervous that going back would disappoint. Fortunately our stay this time was every bit as wonderful as the last. Giuseppe the concierge and the rest of the front desk welcomed us like we were patrons that stayed there all the time. They made great recommendations for museums and dining as well. All in all, I would recommend to my pickiest friend to stay at the Hotel Majestic if your are going to Rome.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic - it has a great location between the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Friendly staff, well appointed rooms though rather small. Highly recommended. For great meals go a few doors down to Cafe Suggestum, great sandwhiches, coffee, meals etc.
reviews.title: A great choice while in Rome
What a pleasure!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Rome at the hotel majestic in October this year. We absolutely loved it. Apart from the beauty of the hotel and it's wonderful location what made our stay memorable was how friendly and charming all the staff were.
We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent special stay for my husband's 50th birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From arrival to departure our 5 night stay at the Hotel Majestic, was splendid. I had mentioned on booking that it was a special stay for my husband's birthday, there was fresh fruit and chilled Prosecco in our room on arrival. Then on his birthday they left us a lovely bottle of wine and a card for him. Room was fabulous, very comfy bed and a super spacious bathroom. The room was spotlessly clean. We took advice of other trip adviser reviews and took breakfast outside the hotel, there are lots of super places for breakfast on the doorstep. If you like mojitos I can thoroughly recommend the Mojito that I had in the hotel bar one evening! Excellent stay and it really did live up to our expectations. Thank you Hotel Majestic :-)
reviews.title: Great location, great experience
Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. It is an old property that has been completely renovated and modernized to today's standards. it is full of charm and character from the high ceilings and moldings to the old fashion cage elevator. We were greeted with a bottle of prosecco and fruit upon our arrival to our room. The room itself was large, had a large closet and nice bathroom. The bed was a king and was plush. It was made up luxuriously and was the most comfortable one we had throughout our stay in Italy. The hotel is well located; it is within walking distance of the Trevi fountain, the spanish steps, great shopping and fantastic restaurants. It is also on a street that has cafes/bars so if you want to stop in for something late night, it is very convient. The hotel staff are a little formal but very helpful and informative. This is definitely a wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a Luxury room on the third floor, streetside. Insulation could be better, especially with the adjacent rooms. It's very disturbing waking up with because of the loud whistling of the plumbing. Nevertheless: spacious rooms (no ensuite coffee-tea), well maintained in the grandeur of the past (original lift, lots of marbel, thock carpets, ...). Bathroom a bit to small for the room. Everything spic and span! Very professional and helpfull staff, an example for many others. Breakfastroom, bar and lobby (left of the reception) all breathe the same atmosphere of grandeur. Very well situated, close to Spanish Steps, Trevi, ... I'd recommend, but ask for a room not on the streetside.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Majestic on our first night of our honeymoon before starting a cruise in the western mediterranean. The hotel is excellent and the service was 5 stars. The hotel is spotless clean and so was the room. Spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious. The location is unbeatable, with multiple small cafe's and restaurants right outside the hotel's doorstep. The conceirge staff are very helpful. Everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel amongst the Leading Hotels of the World group.
reviews.title: Fantastic start to our honeymoon

reviews.text: I stayed at the Majestic Rome back in August 2011. It truly was majestic! We came from a disappointing hotel in Positano, so were happily surprised with The Majestic. The service was wonderful, the rooms spacious, clean, modern and beautiful. Location - can't be better. Breakfast included was also very good. I wouldn't stay anywhere else the next time I travel to Rome.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at The Majestic Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very lucky to have a top floor, spacious suite with a small balcony which caught the sun most of the day. The hotel is on the Via Veneto, which is a pleasant tree lined busy road leading to Villa Borghese. Lots of little restaurants on the door step.
reviews.title: Perfect Break in Roma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely old building which has fascinating photographs of its history from 1940's and 50's on the walls. Staff and service are superb and unobtrusive. Comfortable, welcoming, definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Five star hotel is what you get

reviews.text: We had 2 rooms which were very nice. Our room had mirrors every were you looked. The bed was comfortable. We were in room 322 and our friends were in 323 recomend you dont book those rooms as the bottle collection starts at 7.00am every morning belowe the two rooms windows. Breakfast at 30 euros a head is not value for money. We had breakfast with other hotel resdents at the bar next door for 14 euros a head.
reviews.title: Good Hotel and very good staff

reviews.text: The hotel staff are very good and helpfull. The beds are comfortable. The rooms are nice.
reviews.title: Cool Italian style meets traditional chic

reviews.text: Just returned from a very short stay. I used the hotel for a meeting and overnight stay. Although I've been to Rome before and know its in a great location. I received a very warm welcome on my very late arrival. The hotel entrance is traditional and grand. I was then shown to my room and taken up in the hotel's traditional elevator. It was great just like being in a Hitchcock movie. The room was large and the red accent colours gave the room a contemporary lift, although don't go expecting 21st century decor this is a traditional hotel that's had a very sympathetic contemporary uplift. The breakfast and service was superb. Lovely staff who can't do enough for you. During our meeting we kept requesting coffees and these turned up in seconds without the usual chase. The lunch buffet is somewhat of a legend as business people pour in from around the local area. The Italian buffet is amazing and well worth trying even if you are not a resident. There is a huge lounge on the first floor where you could stay snuggled all day if you were tired of this amazing city. The mosaic ceiling has a modern lighting system which turns this traditional salon into something else and the huge lamps and leather sofas give it that "I want to live here" feeling!
reviews.title: Perfect stay and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and the interior stylish. Rooms are quite, the sound of Via Veneto is absolut ok. The service at the frontdesk was perfect 24h. I have forgotten my gloves and the hotel sent it back to Germany for free. That is unique!!!. Also the concierge service was extremly good. The location is good and all tips for restaurants etc. very good.
reviews.title: Good hotel, expensive breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet for free on three standalone PCs in a businesscenter.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

reviews.text: We were a family of six looking for a Rome hotel in a convenient location that could accommodate us without having to book 3 separate rooms. The Hotel Majestic delivered perfectly.
reviews.title: Great value for family in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the Via Veneto, close to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and lots of shopping options.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Amazing Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Concierge staff was extremely helpful and most efficient in our last minute requests.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: We had two triples rather than three doubles, so it was an affordable option, especially if you are looking for one of the nicer hotels in Rome.
reviews.title: A hotel that lives up to its name

reviews.text: The rooms were large and the bedding very comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent visit to the Majestic in Roma!
Excellent stay at the Majestic
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Majestic Roma for two days and it was more than a 5 star experience. When we first arrived, we were greeted warmly by both the doorman and reception staff. The rooms were spacious and elegant. We had a welcome note and fruit in our room which was a very nice touch. Location of the hotel is central - about 10 mins walk to both the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. It's a 30 min walk to the Colosseum. Will definitely be our first choice to stay at if we were to visit Rome again.

Everything was excellent, including the very friendly and helpful staff. I got a single room and wasn't sure what to expect, but the twin bed was very comfortable and the room still felt luxurious. This hotel has a lot of character and it's in a perfect location for sightseeing and restaurants. I want to go back already!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From when we first arrived at Hotel Majestic it felt as though we were staying in a premier hotel with world class staff. The rooms are outstanding and the location is very central. We easily walked to the Spanish steps. The front desk also had some great suggestions for where to eat. This hotel is top notch.
reviews.title: World class hotel in a great location

reviews.text: I just returned home after a week at the Hotel Majestic in Roma and every day was amazing! Great location, just minutes from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and many more amazing sights. We walked everywhere all day and night and felt perfectly safe.The staff was so nice and accommodating! The rooms are gorgeous and clean. The food was fabulous! We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant every day and one of our party had dinner in one evening.They provide plenty of dresser and closet space, but you cannot have an iron in your room in Italy, so don't bother carrying one, or requesting one. Have laundry take care of it for you. They are prompt and helpful. The only problem we had staying here was the in room safe kept locking us out, but they came right away to fix it .One of my favorite things, the windows open!! Hate when they seal
reviews.title: So Elegant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: them shut!
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice but it was dated. Our shower head fell off in the middle of a shower. Food was very good, staff was friendly and in a good location. I did love the decor in the hall ways all old pictures of celebrities, was pretty cool. The hotel was near the Borghese Gardens, Trevi fountain and alot of shopping, and restaurants
reviews.title: Nice but dated

reviews.text: Good location, reasonable prices large nice rooms good restaurant superb service. Very good concierge and service. Friendly atmosphere. Gives you a feeling of home and not a tourist trap or factory Our 14 year old son enjoyed very much. Nice fitness hall.
reviews.title: GOOD EXPERIENCE IN ROME

reviews.text: We booked 3 rooms for our family stay. I'm a Leading Hotel Club member so complementary continental breakfast was included but room upgrade was not offered. The staff were mostly warm and friendly. It's not a big hotel so after a couple of days you get to interact with most of the staff. Like many Rome hotels the rooms have actual keys with a heavy key ring so it's one of those hotels where you return the key to the front desk whenever you go out and ask for it when you're back. This can be a nuisance when other guests are at the desk and the lone receptionist is busy with them. I also don't like announcing my room number either. The room size was average euro size. The bathroom lacked a separate shower. The rooms could use updating and better window insulation. We were on the 4th floor but you could hear the music from an adjacent cafe till late. Breakfast was served in the ground floor bar area as the main dining room is undergoing renovation. The buffet was basic continental fare with an a la carte menu for eggs, etc..
reviews.title: Classic hotel

reviews.text: Overall it's a 5 star hotel with a certain charm to it.
reviews.title: Hotel needs renovation and updating, unhelpful front desk at check-in

reviews.text: The Hotel Majestic prides itself on being a 5-star hotel. My family of 4 stayed there for 4 nights in August but we weren't impressed.
reviews.title: Heavenly hotel

description: Neoclassical Hotel (1889) located in heart of Via Veneto district, 1 km to train, 30 km to FCO airport.
